intro: Phelypaea hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's water fern, is a rare and delicate aquatic plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, floating leaves that resemble those of water clover. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshes and ponds. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically submerged, and it plays a role in maintaining water quality by filtering nutrients. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered endangered in many areas.
